sect4.title: Introduction
sect4.para: The Redirector helper allows you to use a redirector object to furfill your applications needs as to redirecting to a new url. The has numerous benefits this has over the _redirect() method such as being able to preconfigure sitewide behavior into the redirect object, or using the built in goto($action, $controller, $module) interface similar to that of Zend_Controller_Action::_forward().

sect4.title: Basic Usage Example
sect4.para: Please see the usage example below:
sect4.programlisting:
<?php
// from the dispatched action method
class SomeController extends Zend_Controller_Action
{

    /**
     * Redirector - defined for code completion
     *
     * @var Zend_Controller_Action_Helper_Redirector
     */
    protected $_redirector = null;
    
    
    public function init()
    {
        $this->_redirector = $this->_helpers->getHelper('FlashMessenger');
        
        // set the default options for the redirector
        $this->_redirector->setCode('303')
                          ->setExit(false)
                          ->setGoto("this-action", "some-controller");
    }
    
    public function myAction()
    {
        /* do some stuff */

        $this->_redirector->redirectAndExit();
        return; // never reached
    }
}


// ALTERNATE EXAMPLE
// from the dispatched action method
class AlternativeController extends Zend_Controller_Action
{

    /**
     * Redirector - defined for code completion
     *
     * @var Zend_Controller_Action_Helper_Redirector
     */
    protected $_redirector = null;
    
    
    public function init()
    {
        $this->_redirector = $this->_helpers->getHelper('FlashMessenger');
    }
    
    public function myAction()
    {
        /* do some stuff */

        $this->_redirector->gotoUrl('/my-controller/my-action/param1/test/param2/test2');
        return; // never reached since default is to goto and exit
    }
}
